description.narrative: This project engage in mobilisations and capacity building among communities in the growth corridors of Beira and Nacala, and with this deepen and enlargen the MAM movement building process. In particular the project will be reaching out to communities aff ected by tree plantations in the Beira corridor in the districts of Namaroi, Ile e Mulevala (province of Zambezia), Sussundenga, Gondola and in the district of Manica (province of Manica); aswell as in the Nacal corridor in Mecubure (province of Nampula). ADECRU tells that in these areas it is estimated some 4000 families are affected by the tree plantations, and some 1.325.386 families indirectly. Secondly, the project will be reaching out to communities affected by agrobusiness projects as ProSavana and t he development project of Vale do Rio in the corridor of Nacala in the province of Nampula. The ProSavana campaign in its totality reaches out to an estimated 4,5 million people threatened by the plans. In addition, instead of as in the previous phase the previously organised exchange visit between communities, a larger regional meeting is planned in order to maximise outreach. Partners in this process which have also collaborated in the previous project with ADECRU are the Commission for Justice and Peace of Nampula and Nacala; The rural provincial unions of Nampula and Zambezia. Under the ProSavana campaign, ADECRU continues to work with in particular Justica Ambiental, UNAC, and Forum Mulher, in addition to more than 20 organisations and social movement i n Brasil and Japan. http://adecru.wordpress.com
